qas.question: When was the DIN system established?
What was proposed at the VIII International Congress of Photography?
Who presented the idea that grew into the DIN?
Where was the VIII International Congress of Photography held?
When were the drafts by Deutscher Normenausschuß für Phototechnik made?
What was the abbreviation for the Deutscher Normenausschuß für Phototechnik drafts?
When was Deutsche Gesellschaft für photographische Forschung founded?
Who founded the VIII. International Congress of Photography?

context: The DIN system, officially <b6_0>DIN standard 4512<b6_0/> by <a1_0>Deutsches Institut für Normung<a1_0/> (but still named Deutscher Normenausschuß (DNA) at this time), was published in <a0_0><b5_0>January 1934<b5_0/><a0_0/>. It grew out of drafts for <a2_0>a standardized method of sensitometry<a2_0/> put forward by Deutscher Normenausschuß für Phototechnik as proposed by the committee for sensitometry of the Deutsche Gesellschaft für photographische Forschung since <b7_0>1930<b7_0/> and presented by <a3_0><b9_0>Robert Luther (de)<b9_0/> (1868–1945) and Emanuel Goldberg (1881–1970)<a3_0/> at the influential VIII. International Congress of Photography (German: Internationaler Kongreß für wissenschaftliche und angewandte Photographie) held in <a4_0><b8_0>Dresden<b8_0/><a4_0/> from August 3 to 8, 1931.
